t: 1 Chronicles 24
The Divisions of Priests
These*p were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron: The*p sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as the priests.
With the help of Zadok a descendant of Eleazar and Ahimelek a descendant of Ithamar, David separated them into divisions for their appointed order of ministering.

A larger number of leaders were found among Eleazar’s descendants than among Ithamar’s, and they were divided accordingly: sixteen heads of families from Eleazar’s descendants and eight heads of families from Ithamar’s descendants.
They divided them impartially by casting lots, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of God among the descendants of both Eleazar and Ithamar.

The*p scribe Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officials: Zadok the priest, Ahimelek son of Abiathar and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites—one family being taken from Eleazar and then one from Ithamar.
The*pln first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the*ln second to Jedaiah,
the*ln third to Harim, the*ln fourth to Seorim,
the*ln fifth to Malkijah, the*ln sixth to Mijamin,
the*ln seventh to Hakkoz, the*ln eighth to Abijah,
the*ln ninth to Jeshua, the*ln tenth to Shekaniah,
the*ln eleventh to Eliashib, the*ln twelfth to Jakim,
the*ln thirteenth to Huppah, the*ln fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
the*ln fifteenth to Bilgah, the*ln sixteenth to Immer,
the*ln seventeenth to Hezir, the*ln eighteenth to Happizzez,
the*ln nineteenth to Pethahiah, the*ln twentieth to Jehezkel,
the*ln twenty-first to Jakin, the*ln twenty-second to Gamul,
the*ln twenty-third to Delaiah and*ln the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

This*p was their appointed order of ministering when they entered the temple of the Lord,*s according to the regulations prescribed for them by their ancestor Aaron, as the Lord,*s the God of Israel, had commanded him.
The Rest of the Levites
As*p for the rest of the descendants of Levi: from*ln the sons of Amram: Shubael; from*ld the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.
As*ld for Rehabiah, from his sons: Ishiah*ld was the first.
From*ln the Izharites: Shelomoth; from*ld the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
The*ln sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.
The*ln son of Uzziel: Micah; from*ld the sons of Micah: Shamir.
The*ld brother of Micah: Ishiah; from*ld the sons of Ishiah: Zechariah.
The*ln sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The*ld son of Jaaziah: Beno.
The*ln sons of Merari: from*ld Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zakkur and Ibri.
From*ln Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
From*ln Kish: the son of Kish: Jerahmeel.*ld
And*ln the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These*p were the Levites, according to their families.

They also cast lots, just as their relatives the descendants of Aaron did, in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelek, and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites. The families of the oldest brother were treated the same as those of the youngest.
